main event: An object was observed in Torrance, California, on March 17, 1956, appearing round when still and 'ish shaped' when turning, with bright white color and violet exhaust.
interesting points: The object hovered at an altitude of 210 degrees and 45 degrees elevation., It was 30 feet in diameter and emitted bright white color with violet colored exhaust., The duration of observation was one hour and thirteen minutes., Witnesses initially mistook the object for a meteorite., The object was confirmed to have characteristics similar to Venus.
sighted object: a round object with violet exhaust
witness description: the witnesses initially observed the object while driving and reported intelligent observations
